job_title: Cardiac Monitor Technician in Duluth, MN
pros: Free ramp parking at certain shift times, decent pay
cons: Poor management, VERY cliquey among employees and supervisors, made it a toxic environment to work in, ultimately driving me to leave. Very little hands-on training at the beginning, and as a new employee, you’re treated as less than everyone else. They do not help you learn, but rather belittle you to your face and behind your back. Rarely saw my actual manager or supervisor, and they didn’t seem to take the time to get to know you or help you get started in your position. They throw you some training material and modules and that’s about it. The job felt more like a constant competition rather than an inclusive, team-oriented environment.

job_title: Community Health Specialist in Virginia, MN
pros: They have good benefits and the majority of people hired are wonderful. They have a good focus on community health with a sizable budget, which is rare in healthcare. They genuinely care about mental health.
cons: My pay was based on my past experience that directly related to the job. Since I have a different background, I got offered a low pay rate to start. They didn't take into account my general experience from previous jobs that related to the position. Basically they used a formula and it didn't account for any of my previous experience. Providers are not well trained on how to deal with LGBTQIA+ folks, black, indigenous, or any other minority. I've heard some awful things said about patients who live at the poverty level and patients from the reservation. Their training on how to handle mental health issues is not adequate. Overall I'd say the most frustrating thing about working here is that we have a great community health department who understands these issues, but we get very little time in front of physicians to explain SDOH so they can better serve their patients. Also the structure is still a, get patients in and out the door as fast a possible, model.

pros: Most employees are very pleasant and friendly.
cons: A bit behind the times with technology, pay is OK for the area, but poor compared to the rest of the country, benefits are poor.  People at higher level can be catty and put themselves at a higher standard than everyone else.  If you don't fit into their click or agree with management you are puhed out. I became pregnant shortly after starting, and was bullied with write ups and verbal warnings until I went on maternity leave.  Then I was denied leave and told they were going to fill my position.  No compassion for the highest office in the company.  HR completely backed the company, even though I was being harassed until I left.

review_title: Amazing if you work in the right spot
pros: Good benefits, friendly people, good hours, competitive pay, understanding management, good possibility of upward movement, new ideas are encouraged and cultivated
cons: Some issues never get addressed or are stalled because of the Union and human resources trying to do the right thing. The stalling prevent some issues of being solved ultimately.

review_title: If you can get through the application process

There are quite a few friendly people working in this region.
competitive pay across all departments
high safety standards
cons:
no communication
poor organization in the Central region, both departmental and as a whole
absolutely no organization between regions
extremely high turnover

pros: Plenty of opportunities to work overtime nearly every paycheck. If you can get in it’s a great jumping off point to advance your career in the healthcare field. Flexible for college students.
cons: Be prepared to be exhausted running your tail end off.  High stress environment that runs you ragged for a low wage. My specific department has no employee moral boosting. Everyone on the team feels completely worthless to the company and feel like slaves to low wages with increased amount of work that is required of us to do.

review_title: This is a large healthcare facility that is doing well in the industry.
job_title: Patient Services Assistant in Duluth, MN
pros: This company does have decent benefits and for the position that I worked in I was a member of the union which meant I got yearly pay raises.  There was room for advancement to a certain extent and each time I transferred I was offered more money.
cons: Like any company there are cliques.  The con of working for a union, or one of them, is that everything goes by seniority so if someone worked there longer they would get first choice for transfers and time off.

pros: Supervisors were generally nice and easy to deal with. They were also relatively flexible with hours and scheduling around my class schedule.
cons: The work became repetitive and dealing with impatient and rude customers got old pretty fast, but that's food services jobs for you. The group of coworkers was also pretty small so when one wasn't working as hard as the rest it would get pretty frustrating.

job_title: Support Services Professional in Duluth, MN
pros: Decent pay. Good health insurance. Some really nice people.
cons: If you are a good worker, your reward is more and more work. It is impossible to meet client expectations when spread so thin. Conflicting messages about what is important and what we should focus our attention to.

pros: Most of the people were friendly and fun to work with.
cons: There seems to be no room for advancement for most people.  There seem to be a few employees that are favored and get to move from position to position.  There was no tuition assistance available even though they promote it.

review_title: I have been here for almost 14 years and I think it us one of the better places to work in the area.
pros: Advancement opportunities. Many different departments that give you a variety of options. People are pleasant to work with in all departments.
cons: It isn't located in the best area. A lot of crime  in this area. The insurance benefits are OK, a little high especially when you have to care a family plan.

review_title: Great! Just wished it paid more.
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Superior, WI
pros: Great environment, wonderful administrator and DON! I came from working at a nursing home and I made $18 an hour there, but here I only make $15.47. That is the only thing I wish I could change.
cons: The pay is not the best.

review_title: opportunity to learn and grow career if you fit
pros: Mission based founded on Benedictine values.  Great views and some facilities are beautiful.  Quality patient care.  Opportunities for training and learning.
cons: Scrambling to prepare for health care reform, managers have too much to do.  Workforce has sense of entitlement and the many unions intimidate managers and can make managing employees a challenge.  Moving away from Benedictine roots.

pros: Essentia is an innovative, service oriented organization in a vibrant, welcoming community located on the beautiful shores of Lake Superior.
cons: This is a large system and it can sometimes take a while to see progress on tasks or issues because the processes for effecting change take time.

pros: They do give you flex time 2 hours to use every two weeks for appointments.
cons: Management is terrible, The supervisor, is horrible. Everyone reports on everyone, you must go to management to tell someone if something is wrong, there is no support inter department, it falls all on the Team lead who is over worked. The 401K they do not match. The supervisor is on a hunt for drones to be able to work for her. Input is not welcome, because they are always prevented from changing things to help out the patients. People go through that department like a revolving door.

review_title: Small Town Big Business...do they mix
pros: Great team atmosphere on the individual floors. Great pay for the area and flexible work schedules.
cons: Out of touch management, headquarters is in Duluth and is not employee friendly or convenient if you have issues with benefits.  Insurance is horrible. Very little incentive to continue education to higher level.

pros: I had a great boss, great tools and the opportunity to grow in my skills and experience.  Overall, a great company to work for.
cons: As with any company that an individual could work for, there are always opportunities for improvement in the organization in which one is employed. I think EH had some of the same challenges and opportunities that other Healthcare providers had.
